intro: Teucrium montbretii subsp. montbretii, commonly known as French germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its aromatic foliage and long blooming period make it a popular choice in horticulture.
